intro: Dicksonia mollis, commonly known as the silver fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery, silver-green fronds that give it its distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with each leaflet being broad and lance-shaped. Dicksonia mollis plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's forests, providing habitat and contributing to the local biodiversity.
